definition: Poseidon, God of the sea in Greek mythology
Poland/Polish/abbr. for 波蘭|波兰[Bo1 lan2]
Serbia/Serbian/abbr. for 塞爾維亞|塞尔维亚[Sai1 er3 wei2 ya4]
to stop up/to squeeze in/to stuff/cork/stopper
to stop up/to stuff/to cope with

sentences.english: Nereid, goddess of the sea and the wife of Poseidon.
sentences.chinese: 海中仙女，海的女神，波塞冬之妻。

sentences.english: Poseidon and Apollo wanted only the vine of gold as payment for their work.
sentences.chinese: 波塞冬和阿波羅僅僅要一根金絲作爲他們工作的報酬。

sentences.english: The walls built by Poseidon and Apollo were impregnable5).
sentences.chinese: 波塞冬和阿波羅建造的城牆堅不可摧。

sentences.english: Poseidon smiled at Goddess and knew she had won.
sentences.chinese: 波塞冬朝女神微笑着，他知道女神的心願終於實現了。

sentences.english: Poseidon offered a strong horse needed for war.
sentences.chinese: 波塞冬則提供一匹驍勇善戰的馬。

sentences.english: Poseidon and Athena7 each wanted the honor.
sentences.chinese: 海神波塞冬和雅典娜女神都想得到這份殊榮。

definition: Lucifer (Satan's name before his fall in Jewish and Christian mythology)
Amun, deity in Egyptian mythology, also spelled Amon, Amoun, Amen, and rarely Imen
